# Task

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
using Markdown

function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = Vector{String}()
    answers = Vector{String}()

    for (section, content) in Markdown.parse(md)
        if section == "# Question"
            push!(questions, strip(content))
        elseif section == "# Answer"
            push!(answers, strip(content))
        end
    end

    return (questions[1], answers[1])
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown.parse` function to parse the given markdown text into a tree structure. It then iterates over this structure looking for sections that start with "# Question" and "# Answer". For each answer found, it is stripped of leading whitespace and newlines before being added to the corresponding vector. Finally, it returns the first question and its associated answer as a tuple.
